alert.note: Alert for Clinton (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 6:42PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Whiteside, Carroll and northeastern Clinton Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 641 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Argo Fay, or near Mount Carroll, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Chadwick around 650 PM CDT. Fairhaven around 655 PM CDT. Milledgeville around 700 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Coleta, Emerson and Sterling. This includes Interstate 88 between mile markers 30 and 37. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
